Huge failure and disappointment. I love Metro series and played all - I even played more than a few times on a certain series. Was excited to play this Exodus but ended up just a big disappointment. Bad game play, graphics, shooting etc. This is the end of being Metro fan for sure.

Amazing game! I love it so much. For me, Russian girl, there are a lot of warm, native traits. The train came from the 90s. Old pictures, country rooms with nice curtains. Old computers from the 90s. Ahh.. A nostalgy. And a very dynamic, very cool storyline. And the final. I cried at it. Poor Melnick. Gameplay is very, very good. For 20 hours I had only 1 freeze of game. I've already bought an expansion pack - 2 new DLCs. I love all the Metro games, I buy  Metro books (almost every of them). But Metro Exodus is the best of them. Glukhovsky is not only a great writer, he's a great scenarist. Офигенная игра! Здесь все такое родное, как из детства. Вот поезд с купе, будто бы из 90-х. Все эти надписи, календари и картины на стене, занавесочки. Старые телевизоры и компьютеры. Разрушенные деревенские домики с иконами. Все это так мило. Но, конечно же, главное в игре - сюжет. И здесь он на высшем уровне. В меру динамичен, в меру вдумчив. Глуховский как сценарист сильно вырос - только посмотрите, какой финал. Я почти что плакала а конце. Да, я очень люблю Метро, не пропускаю почти ни одной новой книги. Но как игра - Исход лучшая в серии. Я уже купила новые дополнения, что и вам советую. Смело берите игру, не пожалеете.

Bought the game, downloaded it and installed it. It won't even open. Checked the Internet and there are dozens of potential fixes to get it to run. Absolute garbage software. Release something that works.
Completely broken bugfest that makes Fallout 76 and Anthem look like decent games.

When Last Light was released, I was so surprised by its quality that until now I was personally always thinking about as a similar experience to the masterpiece that had been released a few months before - the one and only Bioshock Infinite. After this sequel however, I am not sure anymore if I can keep thinking that, because even though the overall atmosphere was outstandingly captured throughout the whole variety of all the non-repetitive post-apocalyptic locations, making the gameplay not boring, considering there's not much originality in it, it was seriously difficult to enjoy the game as a whole, when most of the times someone is talking to you in the most generic monologues I have probably ever encountered in a game so far, unable to stop even after 5 minutes of observing that NPC in disbelief, just to see how many lines of monologues it has (not mentioning when those NPCs start to argue). This somehow doesn't make sense to me, since I've read all the books, and despite me not being able to enjoy the sequels as much as the first one, there's absolutely no doubt that it is really well-written. And the last thing I would say about Exodus is that it is well-written, because in comparison to the books, most of the dialogues here seem like a 15-year old's first try for a post-apo novel, making every character  more and more intolerable with every attempt to relate to them, and care for them, resulting in the exact opposite.
Just wanted to change my score because the game improved quite a lot since launch and i fully recommend it.

Exodus is the best game in the franchise. it has some gorgeous graphics and the game is long. it took me over 30 hours to completely finish it. the story is okey with different endings. shooting mechanics are pretty awesome and some weapons are pretty cool. there are many spooky moments through out the game. Many diversified environments. Some side missions and the game is semi open world. it is good game.

"More of the same" describes Exodus rather accurately. Weapons and gameplay are not anything you haven't seen before with the Redux titles and graphically Exodus does not really evolve from the Redux titles either - you'll be hard pressed to see a significant visual upgrade. The game itself is merely "fine", following Artyom on yet another slog facing mostly the same thing you have done before only this time you get to ride a train and go above ground a lot more. In terms of performance Exodus is very poorly optimised, or at the very least you can criticise the developers for taking away the swath of advanced graphical options the Redux titles offer and essentially leave you with dreadful "profile" type options, there is far too much baked in to these "profiles" to allow any sort of flexibility you would expect from a PC title. This game is one almost everybody should be able to play on at least "High" settings, but once again, the lack of graphical options you would expect from a PC title cripple performance forcing far more people than needed to drop to "Medium" which is just a slap in the face as this setting removes far too many graphical aspects and almost ends up looking worse than the Redux titles (which I can happily run on max settings at about 100FPS average). What posessed 4A to remove the flexibility of the graphical options I don't know but I hope the reprocussions of their actions have reverberated loudly with them. I'd like to say the game at least has a stable frame rate, but it really doesn't. I can look into the far distance with the engine fully rendering the terrain, trees, buildings, etc and get triple digit FPS even on ultra settings, but if I dare turn around and look inside the train that FPS plumments to about 40. Editing the config file for this game is a waste of time almost everything is hard coded, you can get a rather large framerate improvement by disabling TAA, but this then also severely messes up lighting in the game, everything is just a damn mess technically speaking. Exodus isn't a terrible game it has its moments and if you liked the Redux titles there might be something for you here but the technical issues is what earns this game a low score from me.

The third game in the series, it's a definite recommend to anyhow to played the previous 2 but I would say it's probably a much harder sell for people new to the series.Levels can drag a *little* and the standing around while NPC verbose at you for hours on end can be a little wearing on the patience but overall the levels are a really good mix of environments and you are saved from it being too repetitive.I really enjoyed it and it did bring the series to a really nice close.

Waaaay too short and not a lot to do.  It's very scripted and linear, which is not a problem, but when it's this short and offers very little replayability, you aren't really getting your money's worth.  Which is too bad, because the atmosphere, sound effects, music, is spot on.  The only other issue is that the dialogue is extremely cheesy.  I'm not sure if it's how a lot of the dialogue got translated, but the dialogue throughout is very distracting. Overall a pretty good experience, but I was shocked and disappointed with how short the game is.  There are literally just four areas- six if you count the opening segment and a bunker you play through- but there isn't a lot to do in each area, and I really took my time to explore them all.

Good PointsEXCELLENT ATMOSPHERE which reminds us about our lost hopes for STALKER SeriesI found the optimization is not as bad as some people described it.  My system is i5-4500, 16 gb Ram and GeForce GTX 960 2GIG VRam and on low setting I had a pretty stable fps - mainly 55-60 with the drop to 43 in most crowded areas.  And the graphic quality of low setting is already quite decent yet deprived of any latest visual effects.ContThe plot is a complete trash.  The 'horrid writing' Mass Effect Andromeda has been cursed for is a masterpiece of literature comparing to the creation of 4A games and Gluhovsky.Balancing, AI  and nearly everything else. Current metacritic score 6.2 completely reflects the quality of the game.  Too many demerits which ultimately killed gameplay.

Экзодус – посредственная игра и ни разу не Метро. Это какой-то Far Cry с переводным дураком и матерями-одиночками. Причем наиболее удались именно подземные коридорные миссии, а весь этот типа открытый мир на поверхности вызывает только недоумение и вопрос "а вот нахера?".Самое печальное в этой всей истории – это сюжет. Его, по сути, нет. Если вы не считаете за сюжет что-то типа «мы ищем новый дом, но Подмосковье, где все ок (кроме мутантов, но они везде, как показала практика) нам не годится почему-то». В остальном у нас какие-то тактические задачи, мол, нужны спутниковые снимки из Каспия-1 и на чем-то уехать оттуда. Надо добраться до Авроры и уехать отсюда к херам (2 раза). И везде нам тонко намекают, мол, тут херово, но вот в Новосибирске… Ну, и как в приснопамятной HL2 вы уже понимаете, что того самого Новосиба вам не избежать.И вот проходишь ты игру, смотришь титры и думаешь, блин вот во что я только что играл? И вроде на одном дыхании прошел и вроде неплохо было все…а как будто обертку красивую развернул, а там – говно вместо конфеты. Игра ни о чем, филер какой-то вместо достойного завершения серии. Сука, как Масс Эффект – решаются судьбы Галактики, эпичное превозмогание, вроде даже последняя часть более-менее, но финал обсерает все и ты такое сидишь и, мол, какого хера? Только вместо цветной мутотени тут вся разница в количестве могил (острая лучевая болезнь переливанием крови не лечится, даже легкая форма). Что с черными? Они вроде как сквозная тема первых двух частей, а в третьей как будто и нет их (можно мельком увидеть в трех местах, как говорят Интернеты, но сюжетно они не участвуют никак). Анна вроде беременна была во второй части? Ничего объяснить не надо? То, что было в 1 и 2 Метро оставлено позади, то что происходит сейчас – недорассказано и брошено в дыму уходящего поезда. На логику и сюжет положен большой волосатый прибор. Мельник превращается в истеричную 12-летнюю девченку и не обращает внимание, что радист из Ковчега с ним общается как какой-то ударенный пыльным мешком гражданский... Ай, если обращать внимание на всю ту хератень, что не вяжется ни с логикой, ни со здравым смыслом уйдет куда больше 5000 знаков. Так эпично просрать все полимеры...Отдельный привет за Эпик Стор. И особенно за того товарища из разработчиков, который потом в Интернетах говнился на эту тему.

An atmospheric 3rd installment of the Metro franchise, now with a much clearer way to achieve a good ending or a bad ending, given that in the previous game, Artyom died as it required quite an effort to get the good ending. I remembered Anna but not the other guys so can't tell much of the characters. The story is okay and the world atmosphere is fantastic. That post-soviet world building was very accurate. I liked the open-world maps. The main drawback of the game is that one can't skip cutscenes and dialogs, which for the subsequent playthroughts (i.e., Ranger Hardcode or Iron Mode) was kind of frustrating. I found sneaking to be not fun and particularly hard sometimes. Also the game crashed a few times, once during Iron Mode so I lost half a map worth of progress. As for the Epic/Steam debacle, I bought it on Steam discounted after it was released a year later. The exclusivity wasn't such a nice step from the publisher/devs but I knew I won't have the time to play the game right when it released anyway. So I got it cheap, with achievements, guides and most problems already iron'd out.

I love open world games. And i got into this thinking that i would love this too. But ill keep it short. The main thing that ruins this game for me is the fact that the main protaginist dosnt talk. Please, give me one reason why. Is he mute? It´s like he´s retarded. That aside, the gameplay is...ok. the characters are ok. The inviroment is pretty good actually. The ending sucks.

Спасибо, разработчики за столь красивую и чувственную игру! Атмосфера окружения, "семейные узы" с персонажами, красивый большой мир. Сильный прыжок который вам удался. Да, бывают разные баги, но они не мешают игровому процессу. Жаль видеть что многие занижают оценки из-за Стима, но не обращайте на них внимание. Игра у вас вышла отличная и жду с нетерпением ваших следующих проектов. Ваш преданный фанат, Артём.
I played this game only in 2021. I really liked semi-opened world what reminds me STALKER series.

column1: The atmosphere is nice in Volga zone. But nothing else to say.

Review: I like Metro and i liked the game very much. Only that theres no real endboss is a bit sad. But the rest id very nice. Cant wait for metro 4.

Not quite a masterpiece but a good solid game.On the good side it's very atmospheric, has a half decent if predictable story, looks great and has more than good enough performance, it's really good fun exploring the interesting locations and is a lot more open than the previous games. Oh and no microtransactions whatsoever.I can play through this and just enjoy the whole experience without anything becoming irritating. On the bad side there isn't much to complain about but if I had to be picky, the enemies have AI right out of the early 2000's and the weapons are not all that satisfying to use. While nowhere near as bad, it does have a slight 'Fallout' feel to the shooting. Loot is also a little lacking in variety with 90% of the stuff you find being the same crafting materials. On the technical side it is heavily lacking in visual options. This is fine if you have a decent system but I feel if you were on a lower end machine and needed to make some tweaks you would be out of luck. Overall it's not a revolution, it's more Metro with better visuals and some more open ended environments. But for sure ignore the people giving it low scores because of business decisions - this is definitely worth playing.

Metro Exodus is an exodus from what made the Metro series so good in the first place. It's a serviceable entry into a tired series lacking any real distinction of its own.  Where 2033 was a truly visceral, immersive and frightening experience in which you felt attached to the characters who felt like real people, and Last Light was more of the same (if less well executed), Exodus offers beautifully realistic outdoor environments but not a lot more.

The best post apocalyptic game i ever played, you really felt the horror of nuclear war, fallout, plz take note.Amazing visual with ray tracing on, lovable character, i really felt attached to my comrade and especially Anna, my wife.Nowadays,  game ending last 1-2 mins, This game ending will leave you in tear and emotional.  That is after you have wetted your pant, this game can be very scary at time.All in all, amazing story, character, atmosphere, visual.

So close... and yet so far.  This game represents such unrealized potential.  Having played and enjoyed the earlier games, I was hoping for more... but got less.  It's like the developer ran out of time or money and just started cutting corners.  There are some good ideas, partially realized, but mostly it feels like a mish-mash of cobbled-together concepts that lack consistency and depth. The core idea of fleeing Moscow on a train and adventuring a post-nuclear countryside is a classic, yet for some reason plays out like a slide show of maps with only a couple of side quests tossed in for flavor.  The linear tunnel shooter, with minimal choice and loads of cut-scenes, is never far away - forcing you to play your character exactly the way the game has decided he is going to be played.  The ending has already been determined before you first load the game - all the rest is window dressing. I won't dwell on our mute protagonist, which has been mentioned in just about every game review that I've read.  To have NPC's in the game come up and talk to you... and you just stand there silently... is a cringe-worthy moment in any game, and it happens far too frequently in this one. If the game starts with limited open-world adventuring, as you progress you end up back in the linear tunnel shooter full-time.  Some of the levels are literally the exact same as in prior games, with NPC's dismissing the similarity as "all XYZ bunkers were built the same" or "these subway tunnels all have the same configuration".  Sad. The end-game is actually so boring I found myself running through/past all the fights because I just wanted to see how the game was going to turn out.  I no longer cared about my character, or collecting gear, because it felt more and more like nothing I did mattered.  And I was right... because the predetermined end-game is so trite it could have been written by 13 year-old girls. The game IS beautiful.  There were moments on the train where I truly stood and watched the landscape stream by.  The settings are detailed and interestingly crafted - if far too linear.  You will always know what you are supposed to be doing, and where you are supposed to be going.  In some cases the path will even be lit by conveniently placed glowing mushrooms.  Go here... loot this... go there... loot that... cutscene. The game ran fine on my RTX machine, but I still encountered some bugs and graphical anomalies - though no game crashes.  NPC's walking through floors... objects floating in air... strange hit boxes that prevented you from hitting a monster even when you are firing at it at point-blank ranges. The UI is pretty bad as well.  You hit "E" to loot a corpse, and hit "R" to strip a weapon that is lying on the ground... or else you hold down "E" to pick up the weapon and drop whatever weapon you are currently holding.  Hit "F" to turn on your light... or hold "F" to equip your electrical charger... etc.  You soon find yourself holding a key you meant to hit, or hitting a key you meant to hold, and you drop nice gear, or turn off your light - usually at inopportune moments. Ultimately, though, it is the flimsy game story that ruined the game for me.  All the NPC's have as much depth as a puddle, and the dialogue is written for six year-olds.  You end up not caring about what happens, because you don't care about the NPC's that are supposed to be so the reason you are risking your life.  And the never-ending cut-scene at the end of the game?  Is it 15 minutes?  More?  It just goes on and on and on... and trust me, it ain't worth it to stick around to the bitter end.Coulda woulda shoulda.  Game was too short, and even so, I feel no desire to replay it given the linearity and lack of personal choice.  The METRO franchise took a big step backwards with this game. [EDIT] I just learned there is a "good" ending to the game that requires you to sneak past and not kill a significant number of hostile mobs in the game.  So if they see you, they shoot you.  But if you shoot them in self-defense, you die at the end of the game.  In at least one of these cases, I approached a group of (what I thought were neutral) soldiers, with my weapon holstered in the middle of the day.  They immediately shot me down.  And yet... I am supposed to protect these guys?  A horrific game design decision - and one that doesn't make the game more enjoyable, but simply frustrating and tedious.  Talk about suspension of dis-belief.  If I am walking around in a nuclear wasteland and you open fire on me, expect to die.  Even knowing this, I feel no desire to replay the game to get this "good" ending.  The game was too tedious already when I got to fight the hostile mobs.  Having to hide from them and sneak past... the thought makes my eyes bleed.

Just played it for 4 hours. I`m 33 and play a lot of games before.The best graphic and it feels like you in a game! Great work! Congrats!The only one thing - scenario of the game, but anyways GREAT!

Been long time since a game allowed me to lose track of time and sit for over 4 hours (a number of times).  At first the narrative cinema was distracting but, soon getting to the next one became an obsession.  The story was great if you were a teen in the 80's wondering what would happen if some idiot would think a nuclear attack is "an easy win."  The game play is challenging, the graphics were wonderful, and fit the story well. The ending was pleasant yet sad - let's say appropriate and it included some nice dramatic pauses.  Well worth the time.  1 warning -- I probably will not buy off Epic games till I see players mention stable more.  The cloud syncs and frozen screens during saves were very aggravating, too much so.  But, for the comments containing Dev "filler" and bad story I say "not helpful."  4A Games spent a perfect amount of time and thought on this game. A 7-8 for the play and the story made it an easy 9 (a 10 if I was a more romantic type).  Great game.

Amazing game made with passion and love. I'd give it 9 out of 10, but idiots review bombers forced me to give it 10. Anyways it is very good game from start till finish. Story and atmosphere are superb.

Metro exodus is a good game but it lacks what made this series so great. the game only had that metro feel for some parts and in other chapters i didn't know if i was playing far cry, fallout 4 or rage, i know that perhaps the studio felt the need to move outside and try some new things but those are the worst part of the game. i just wish that most of the game felt like the last chapters, **SPOILERS** Theres almost no visions and you barely fight mutants( and they are the same most of the time) instead you spend too much time going from point A to B doing forgettable sidequests.You are forced to not kill almost anyone to get the good ending... The game is far from Metro 2033 and Metro last light but it has its moments, the story is good but nothing groundbreaking. and the A.I is just dead, enemies barely see you and it has a lot of glitches...

This game is frustrating to play. Walking feels slow, riding in the boat is even slower. Shooting is boring. This game is just not fun to play. The only good thing is graphics and atmosphere, but it's impossible to enjoy them because the gameplay is so lame. I have to force myself to keep playing it. Why oh why did the developers not make it more fun to play?
The game is not bad. It's just mediocre in everything except plot. Mediocre gunfight, mediocre gameplay. Plot however is just stupid. It contains a lot of bizarre moments and just not interesting.

The terribly slow this game, a lot of bugs, I'm very desapointment. The load this worst part of all. Playing on ps4 pro. It's a good game but there's a lot of problems. I confess I expected more of this game. I expected more action . Though it's just a slowly game

Я долго ждал эту игру. Когда увидел на е3 я просто офигел. Апгрейднул пк. Игра меня не разочаровала. В игре прекрасная графика, я когда загрузился на волгу офигел от красивых видов. Разработчики решили добавить полуоткрыте миры с мини локациями и квестами, сделано не плохо. Появилось время, теперь можно бегать ночью или днем. Появилась полноценная прокачка стволов. Прокачка магаза, ствола, приклада, и т.д Можно например из револьвера сделать карманную снайперку, а из калаша пулемет. Оружие теперь может испортиться, поэтому надо следить за ним, и постоянно лутаться. У вас постоянно будет не хватать патронов. Сама сюжетка очень интересная, а концовка заставляет рыдать. Атмосфера игра просто не опесуемая. + за Цоя. Баги были, но редко, еще проблемы иногда с регистрацией пуль, но в целом игра просто шикарна. Рекомендую всем

Nice continuation of the metro series, however not as spectacular as i.e. 1st game. Graphics are definitely improved and world looks nice. Gun play could have been slightly better. Sometimes your shots dont register. From time to time an enemy doesnt shoot you from 3 meters but can headshot you easily from 50 meters. Game has some technical bugs however not game breaking.
Сломанная ***** с длс за почку. Не рекомедую ПОКУПАТЬ. Разве что для того чтоб поддержать EGS.

WARNING: Do not buy this game through Epic. All my other games work fine, but this one is a crash fest. Using a 2080 Super. I can not finish the game because I have to do a hard restart over and over no matter what settings I'm on, and the Epic customer support is a joke. I don't know if this is an issue with Metro, or Epic? The gameplay itself wasn't bad. I was enjoying the journey through Russia with my crew, and would have loved to finish the game, but like I said... The graphics are just okay, some images are very blurry. DLSS is completely broken with this game. Turning it off doesn't help the optimization though. The story isn't the most captivating. However being on a train together creates a sensation of always moving forward, and there are some bright moments to be found within the frozen tundras.  Can't recommend on the account of how many times the game has hard crashed my PC. .

Pros:- Not bad story line.- Locations and Graphics.Cons:- Useless open world.- Useless Monsters, which is respawning every time, there is no meaning to kill them, it is waste of resources.- Poor choice of weapons.- There is no instant travel points.- Side quests are too bad.- The main character of game have no ability to speak, total mute, and dialogues are absant too.It was so beautiful on the last map of game, and the metro there reminded me previous games, when there is no hope, everything is dead, only monsters are waiting you, and you struggle in your desperate fight just to live in this hell. And new game atmosphere gives you hope and place where you can live in peace, that is why partialy i do not like new metro exodus.

Last light is my favourite game of this generation, a testament to it being the fact its a remake. I felt this would be overly ambitious for the studio and I was correct . The opening is clunky and weak but are there to draw you from the old games....then this gives way to atmospheric and immersive open levels, but when you feel you are adapting to this the last level really ruins the flow and quality of the game. I felt it would be a better game without the last couple of hours that seemed like padding without any of the open feel of the mid game. Maybe they run out of money or ideas, but it really needed an open sandbox for this section. Positives - Graphics, Weather and day/night cycle, Atmosphere, Sound design, dolby atmos support, mid section of game, Crafting.... Negatives - AI, New creatures, last level, reduction of weird and scary moments, poor and cluttered mix of audio remains, new monsters in last quarter, poor loading time initially, some controller lag on xbox one x, crushed gamma on xbox. HOLD X TO DO STUFF.

So rather than giving the game a knee-jerk rating of 0/10 because I'm an entitled brat or 9/10 because I'm only interested in out-screaming said entitled brats, I'll go ahead and give my thoughts on the game. Shocker, I know. The Metro franchise has been a guilty pleasure of mine since Metro 2033. Both it and Last Light, as well as the Redux versions, hold secure and comfortable spots in my gaming library. They have a certain charm about them, something about a smaller developer punching well above their weight and (mostly) succeeding has always been satisfying for me to see. So when Exodus was announced, I was excited. Fast forward to February 19th, 2019. I got the game, loaded it up, and dove right in. I had been amped for this moment for the entire month. Cue a CTD within 2 minutes of gaining control of Artyom. Not a great start, but to be fair, this was the only crash I experienced over the next 30-ish hours of gameplay. In retrospect, it's one of the least frustrating problems that I had with the game. Overall, the game did meet most of my expectations for a Metro game: Heavy on the story, atmosphere, and pseudo-religious undertones. The characters were charming, their interactions exciting and engaging enough for me to spend time sitting around to listen to their conversations. The crew of the Aurora felt like distinct individuals, only hampered by the average to god awful voice cast employed on this installment. Miller *still* has only one mood/inflection, Artyom's narration is more stilted than the swamp houses in Taiga, and I'm reasonably sure Nastya was voiced by the RL daughter of one of the developers (i.e., she sounds like an actual child but deadpans/stiffly reads lines like one too.) The story itself isn't bad, indeed enjoyable enough to have kept me playing through the game. It won't be winning any prizes anytime soon, either. The biggest plot weakness for me is how disjointed and disconnected the entire early and middle portions of the game feel to the prologue and final two chapters/zones. The plotlines during these sections simply feel unnecessary or uncomfortably forced aside from a few major plot elements. 4A isn't the best at filling 25-30 hours of story, and it is painfully apparent. The main story is only really about 5 or 6 hours worth of content, everything else feels like tacked on filler. Gameplay is, for me, the biggest positive for me in Exodus. Gunplay is great, weapons sound and 'feel' very weighty and punchy compared to 2033/Last Light's cartoony sounds and handling. Firearms even jam and malfunction if you don't properly maintain them. I love the slight return to the OG 2033 gameplay: Artyom is no longer the Tank he was in Last Light, stealth is virtually a requirement for survival, and exploration and scavenging is a priority. Bullets as a currency are gone, but with the new crafting system, they are just as precious of a commodity to the player. Add in needing to craft your medkits and filters instead of being able to just horde MGR and buy them at shops, and you are often faced with an "ammo vs. healing vs. oxygen" dilemma, particularly in the late game. In terms of the AI: It's still Metro, so it's still Euro-Jank as heck...but it's also better. Enemies feel smarter, especially once you tip them off to your presence. They communicate with one another, calling out Artyom's location and working together to pin you down and flank you. Very rarely will enemies rush you in a gunfight. On one occasion, I fell back on tricks from previous games, expecting to be able to lure bandits towards me so I could dispatch them at my leisure. Imagine my surprise when they instead backed me into a corner, surrounded me, and sniped me from a safe distance anytime I poked my head out. With all these benefits, though, the AI still feels very janky at times: Enemies either have x-ray vision and spot you through walls in pitch black darkness or they're blind and deaf mole-men who fail to see you standing two feet in front of them in broad daylight. They often glitch into and through walls, stairs, ladders, and terrain (chase a certain marksman up a certain crane sometime to see what I mean). The biggest pitfalls the game had, the ones that had me swearing at the screen as I reloaded a checkpoint for the seventh time in a row, were all technical. Bullets harmlessly passing through enemies, the prompts to perform melee takedowns arbitrarily being unusable at very inconvenient times, and rubberbanding into visual range of enemies while vaulting/manteling are all very common and infuriating hiccups with the game. This is all exacerbated by the fact 4A decided to use a checkpoint system. While this works for a strictly linear corridor shooter, it can mean losing a half-hour's progress in one of the more open-world levels. Overall, Metro Exodus is a good (but definitely not 8/10 or 9/10 great) entry in the series, and an entertaining FPS.

I really enjoyed Metro Exodus, I encountered a few bugs in my play-through but despite that I think it was fantastic. Incredible atmosphere, great world design, fantastic weapon customisation and mechanics. Great enemies and characters, 4A Games put a great deal of passion and love into this project and it shines through. The likes of Activison and EA need to take note that this is the way to make a game. I realise people are upset about the Epic store exclusivity deal but despite that no one can deny that Metro Exodus is a fantastic game! I think 4A deserves praise for the quality of their craftsmanship.

i played the 2 original games and they were awesome! nut this one is garbage so done waste your time! story is super short and to get the good ending you need to be a good ninja and play the boring way. anyhow the game ends with so many questions and a void of nothing i was surprised and sad when the game ended because many stuff needed to be answered and it felt like the game was made by a completely different studio. im glad i didnt pay full price for this garbage and i beg you guys to not waste your time on this game!

What funny is on the walking and searching things on the open world map. I hate OWORLD game. This new style make me angry. You have no mini map, you have no more instruction.... just go and find what boss want... this is not game as I remember. This game is trash.
Сколько же тут овощей, хейтящих метро только из-за того, что она не вышла в стим.

Хорошая игра, сюжет типичный а вот графоний порадовал.Ругают его только те у кого мощей не хватило на ультра настройках поиграть.Стрельба доставила, особенно приятно было пострелять с "ашота" - ух я прям чувствовал мощь.Концовка выбесила: Новосибирск как локация очень атмосферная но вот прогулки в метро оооочень нудные, по здешним врагам "кротам" не всегда проходят выстрелы а черви на стенах получились просто бесячими. В целом финальным забег за лекарством получился крайне унылым и хотелось просто по быстрее что бы все закончилось. Еще отмечу тупость и не всегда логичную привязку морали что сказывается на концовке. Мне досталась плохая и посмотрев то как нужно получать хорошую - желание перепроходить игру отбилось на прочь. А так в целом игра доставила.
На GTX 1050 всё отлично идёт, страшных багов не нашёл. Отличная атмосфера, хорошая графика, и отличное погружение. Смерть Стимо-болам.

Помойная оптимизация, кринжовый сюжет и озвучка персонажей, неинтересная стрельба и МЕХАНИКА СУРРЕНДЕРА НПСИШЕК. Это когда против тебя сдаются 5 полно воруженных любых челиков. Псевдо открытый мир, неинтересные локации, дропнул в середине, просто убожество. Да и другие части не славились особой крутостью.

Quite good, but it moved from shooter to rpg-ism - which is ok, but then again it's not an rpg at the same time.At least the valley was very pretty, interesing story all around how strange communities came up in all the places.Overall good, not groundbreaking though.Graphics are very good.

-1 за глючный лончер-1 за анимацию лиц-1 за отсутствие реиграбельности/багиА в остальном игра супер - сюжет, музыка, атмосфера - все это вместе заставляет играть и играть часами. За личиной рельсового шутана можно разглядеть старое доброе метро.

What a great game.  First, it's so refreshing to see a FPS game through the eyes of another culture.  There are no Vin Diesel or Tom Clancy characters in this game.  The characters in Metro Exodus feel authentically human and relatable.  I felt the situations and emotions at a gut level like it was real.The writing and direction in this game are top notch just like the beautiful graphics.  Combat is a life or death situation every time, as it should be.  You won't find yourself mindlessly sprinting to the next goal in this game!  You must use stealth whenever possible, and more importantly, stay aware of your situation. If I had to pick one negative thing about this game it would be some occasional glitchy pathing on rough terrain, but it is rare and not game breaking. I really hope to see more Metro games in the future.  That's why I'm so disappointed that some members of the community are review brigading this game because it's on the Epic store.  This behavior truly shows how immature and petty some gamers are.  All you need to do is play an online game for a few minutes to verify this fact.  So don't pay attention to these 1 and 0 scores... you will love this game.

First off, I DO NOT CARE about the Epic Games Store and it has no bearing on my score. Now i loved the other Metro games but this one, I just do not know how I feel about it. It seemed that there was more scripting than ever before and it appeared disjointed for me like never before.  Yes the graphics are awesome BUT it plays in a choppy way once you have played for around 1/2 an hour. With a GTX 1080 i expected a little more than this and even putting graphics down to low I still had a frame drop and chop about every 30 secs much like many many people I have seen. The story is ok at best and to be honest I feel it is not the best in the series I think Last Light gets that accolade. I am sorry but I stopped playing very early on due to lag spikes and also the way the game tells you to go somewhere but for the love of god i couldnt find what it wanted me to do when i got there. I ended up giving up and I cannot see me restart anytime soon. Maybe if they  get the choppyness gone i will try again but I feel let down.

4A Games отличились. Создали линейный шутер в котором нужно как можно меньше убивать. Браво! Молодцы!А если серьезно то чем постоянно упарываются разрабы из 4A Games когда придумывают такие гениальные механики для шутера, непонятно. В нормальных играх выбор игрока в той или иной ситуации влияет на концовку, а не стиль прохождения. Тем более что игра в пост апокалиптическом сеттинге. А как известно в таких реалиях человеческая жизнь ценится очень низко. Это игра не плоха, но на игру года или шедевр не тянет.﻿ Вот например если я не умею играть по стелсу или не хочу этого делать? Почему в итоге плохая концовка? Про баги говорить нечего. Они те же что и в первом Метро. Ну надеюсь пофиксят патчами. Игра эта на 6 - 7 баллов максимум.

I completely don't understand the criticism - those people are either looking for something PERFECT, or have some other issues. Having experienced this game for the second time just now (Enhanced Edition,  finished  regular one in 2019), I am just reinforced in that this is one of the top games of all times without doubt. It can go toe to toe with any other similar game from the top - graphics are top notch, gameplay is excellent, story is excellent, sound, voice acting is so good (person voicing Colonel Miller should get an award) - and the atmosphere in the game is just phenomenal. To me, it does all of those better than, for example, Fallout 3 / NV / 4 (which is one of my favorite franchises) and it barely ever gets mentioned - severely underrated. I mean, Metacritic says "#41 best PC game of 2019" - WHAT?! There were FORTY ONE better games just in 2019?? That's absolutely ridiculous - this is top 50 of all time. Seasons, factions that you encounter are really unique and interesting, the way the worlds reacts to you, the amount and quality of side-stories and lore, each of your team members has a unique personality and is distinct and "alive" - I could go on and on...It has so much more soul than most of other games. Of course it's not perfect and there are so many opportunities that could have made it even better - but nothing is perfect and this game does great. 4A Games have my huge respect, this is an amazing achievement and I hope people that worked on the game are crazy proud about what they created - it deserves all the praise it can get.

This game is very good. The graphics and story is very strong. I didn't like to main character's not speak. The atmosphere is awesome. I really like this game. But the optimization is not good enough.

Lidi jsou vážně stupidní, hru budou schválně shazovat špatnými recenzemi kvůli Epic Store. Za to nemohou vývojáři, ale samotný vydavatel který těsně před vydáním změnil platformu. Díky těmhle lidem, nevznikne další pokračování. Měli by jste se zamyslet, jestli tohle opravdu chcete. Chcete aby kvůli Epic Storu skončila tahle skvělá série. Očividně ano. Ale né radši budeme chamtivé svině a hru si crackneme.

Overall a good game , especialy if you'r into exploration, few bugs here and there , example , saves not working at certain events , clipping weapons on character models , optimization all over the place. But atmosphere is top notch, story is meh and gun play kinda sucks. I recommend anyway.

The game is somewhat mediocre. It's a good game nonetheless compared to previous one. The more open map is definitely one of the greatest point in this game but the feel of urgency is really made the side quest somewhat irrelevant. The graphic is beautiful but sadly there's not many option for PC gamer to customize to find balance performance and look. Cut scenes mainly bad because of voice acting and sound / music choices. The awkward pause, the overlapping voices, and the sound FX when you thought it's gonna be climax scene but in the end it's just feels off. The story is good but at some point it's predictable. Artyom cannot speaks in-game just heartbreaking in a story driven game. The immersion and interaction with other members are just a turn off. But in the end it's the end of Artyom's journey and it's a good send off. FPS and game play mechanics are below average of any modern shooters. The movements are clunky, slow and heavy, you walk like a turtle doing a baby step. Jumping over a small ledge can triggered the slow animation. The AI is not great. Shot can miss when you thought you had a clear shot of the enemy even on a close distance. Crafting another point of the game that can feels unnecessary. Playing pacifist doesn't really need that much ammo since you probably only use it for mutants though sometimes it's just not worth it to fight some mutants. So in the end the game is good. Just some technical choices that developers made is not great.

Nos encontramos ante un juegazo con autentico gameplay, hasta da miedo en algunos puntos, desde luego es de lo mejorcito que trae metro. Lastima que quede sepultado ante un lanzamiento demasiado temprano, la carretilla de problemas técnicos y cosas sin pulir  que arrastra es simplemente descomunal, hasta el punto de que si te hechas hacia atrás en el primer mapa te encuentras con los limites, ni muros invisibles ni nada, vas te tiras al vacío y ala, incluso hay dos modelos de personajes que alguien se dejo ahí sin activar en la hora del almuerzo.Yo no pagaria mas de 50 euros por el.

Amazing graphics for sure. Story is not anything special, but it is good. But this game suffers from bad mechanics. Looking around is sluggish, i have hard time to aim, even i am not having fps drops. Can't carry more than 90 ammo. Accuracy not good either on more than 25m aiming at head with x4 optics and it doesn't hit. Than mutant not dying after whole mag emptied to the head and there is no way to go and than he one hit kills you, killing monsters was more annoying than fun. Than paddling around in a boat isn't much fun, one time it is okay. But than it is annoying, if i need pass small distance, like 10 meter, why do i have to use boat, i may walk across aswell.There is some electric anomaly which killed me 10 times and even it is not in my path, it kills me and i waited long time in order to it to move and it just moves around and where is it most far away, it still kills me. So fun dying repeatedly to it. It is hard to see in game, like it has bad contrast or something, i don't know how to describe it. And multiple times i had trouble to find a way. Not best design.One time you drop to the hole and have to find way out, in this case it is okay, but if i am literally progressing forward, it is annoying to find a way on every corner - like in that hall i have to find that train. Crafting isn't much fun either having constantly to pick some items from boxes, or picking up mushrooms and controls are counter-intuitive bit, not only for crafting, but for everything. Ui not so great either, can't see health for example, or hold tab to switch see and switch rounds. After playing some more, there weren't that many annoyances and not much boat travel. It isn't that bad. there are some interesting locations, tho killing mutants is a bit repetetive. It had couple bugs nothing major.

Es un juego aceptable, visualmente es imponente pero tiene un tema que lleva arrastrando desde el primer metro: el sonido.tanto les cuesta pulir este tema? mas que nada los diálogos, en los que por ahí hay un personaje principal que esta hablando y tienes a un NPC al lado hablando idioteces, en un volumen mucho mas alto, sin contar que cuando se ponen a hablar puedes dejarlos y se quedan hablando solos!Por otro lado, la forma en que llevan la historia, me refiero a la forma de contarla mas alla de las misiones se hace aburrida, densa por momentos, con diálogos y mas diálogos que terminan dispersando la atención y el interés en la historia.Ciertamente el personaje principal tiene el complejo "Gordon Freeman" ya que no dice una sola palabra en estas horas que llevo jugando, lo cual me hace pensar que sus creadores le quisieron dar una fuerte influencia half life, que claramente no tiene.

First and foremost, i have to say that i really enjoyed Metro Last Light and the original iteration of th Metro series. A lot of that due to the fact, that the atmosphere and story was interesting, conclususive and fresh.both parts were produced, working together with the author of the novel, gluchowski, and maybe thats exactly what is lacking in exodus.i don´t care so much about graphics, they are allright in exodus, gunplay is pretty bad, but well i could live with that too, but man, the acting and story are pretty terrible in the first hour of the game.I´m even contemplating if i should even bother to keep playing the game. also the atmosphere of the first games was a tightly woven concept, whereas exodus doesn´t have that character, it seems pretty random honestly. level design is pretty boring as well. damn, that was a pretty smart move, to get epic as the exclusive distributing platform, now people are complaining about that, instead of the fact, that this is a mediocre game.6/10 would refund on steam as well

The game has great graphics but they are poorly optimized.  I really liked the story even more than last night.  The rpg elements that have been added are to the benefit of the game.  I have never really played an open world fps like this.  I would highly recommend this game and it is the best game of the year so far.

Ignore the bad reviewsAnyone who says this game isnt optimized most likely tried turning raytracing on their 1060I on the other hand have a 2080, I7 7700. I consider this highish mid range and I can run this on ultra with 4k resolutions just fine when I lower the shading rate. In regards to the game, its a very decent length with over 3 huge zones to discover. Ignore anyone saying you won't have direction and it lacks a story because if you actually play it correctly you will hit every single extra spot and be super prepared for the later sections. The guns are amazing, lots of different upgrade options and EVERY single gun is useful. Characters are done very well, I was honestly crying at the end. Stealth is done very well, people who suck at video games will say its "too hard" or "impossible" to not kill the guys the games asks you not to kill, but trust me you gotta be braindead to not sneak past these guys. I grinded out the game and beat it within 2 weeks because I loved it so much, I typically get bored half way through games, this time I DID NOT.

I was quite pleasantly surprised with exodus. The game still has a lot of linear scripted sequences like its predecessors, but now they tried to do few small open world areas, and the game has a stalker vibe to it in few places. Shooting is good, and the weapon modification system is really cool. Exodus looks beautiful although performance ranges from fine to real bad depending on the area; Overall i think its a really good game, even though it's quite buggy.

Instant classic. As a 48yo gamer i have played a few FPS single player titles and oh boy this is the game i have been waiting for all my life. The grafics, the atmosphere, the attention to detail, the story. Everything is just right...Thank you 4A games for giving me this top notch game, it is without competition and a benchmark for future titles. A must play for every FPS fan.

This game is absolutely incredible. I ran it with RTX 2080 and used the Ray Tracing, and I have to say it made the game look beautiful. The story is captivating and there is options to listen to more story or to walk away. There is a ton of side dialogue and this builds the world and immerses the player. The ending is superb. I haven't played a game with as good of an ending in a very long time! There were some graphical imperfections such as guns, people and animations clipping through other objects, but this is mostly nitpicking. I never encountered anything game breaking (this is impressive in its own respect, as its hard to perfect an open world game of this size)..The crafting is simple in gathering, as there are only 2 resources to worry about. The crafting of the guns is very in depth and I always looked forward to finding another modification from looting fallen enemies. Guns feel and sound very good. Also, love the dirtying of the weapons. I had to think about which guns I would walk around with in my hands as these would get dirtiest the fastest. Enemy types are somewhat varied, though most of them are just thugs. You can try to stealthily take them down with your fists and this will lead to a reputation of a pacifist (this is what I chose for my first playthrough). You can also blow their brains out with silenced weapons and retain stealth, or go all out with a minigun or some such and take them head on. The outcome of the game will not probably differ too much. These actions will only define how the enemy interprets your character in their side conversations. The mutants in this game are quite interesting also! None of them are too scary (thinking back to Librarians in 2033.... scary!). They have their own attack and movement styles and patterns and make interesting and unique sounds. Characters are all very good. They all seem like a well functioning team and each gets their turn in the story and being alongside with the player, although some get more of the lime light than others. I still cared about each of the members of The Order throughout the game. I've actually made a Metacritic account just to review this game. I think that it is definitely worth paying for (even though I got it for free with my purchase of RTX gpu). I would support these developers and am very hopeful for another entry in this series!
В первую очередь продукт должен давать эмоции, и в конце сюжета игра их выдает просто на 10 из 10
If you like story based games, this is ABSOLUTELY STUNNING! First hour isnt very good but it gets better and better till playing....
Impressive and wonderful game, scenario, characters, gameplay all in high quality level!

I just completed this game on "Ranger Hardcore" difficulty, and it was a BLAST!  I enjoy VERY challenging game play and to that end normally have to DL MODS to get the type of experience i want, in the case of "Metro Exodus" that wouldn't have been necessary even if it were possible.  The story and atmosphere are on par with what I've come to expect from the Metro series, but Exodus takes this experience to new heights.  So few developers produce this level of story telling and 4A should be commended and supported for this epic odyssey.

Spent 3 weeks on the game, and I can assure you it was a pleasant experience. The story is just great, it touched my feelings. Of course, the technical part of the game is not perfect, came across 2-3 bugs, which, nevertheless, didn't spoil the experience much. And, to be frank, this is not the 10/10 game, I'd give 9/10. The reason I am putting the highest rating possible is the army of strange people, who are literally bombing the game with 0s and 1s just for the fact IT IS NOT ON STEAM. Literally, no one is complaining about their origin and battlenet clients, but everyone claims EGS is bad "because I have to install another launcher". What's the point?I just wanted to say I loved the game, it is a good continuation of the first two metro games, and if you liked them, don't be afraid to pay and play Metro Exodus - you will never regret about it! Спасибо за хорошую игру, с нетерпением жду продолжения!

Hands-down the best game I have ever played. The atmosphere is unreal and indescribable, and the graphics are unparalleled. This vibes of being in a post-WW3 world didn't leave me for at least a week IN REAL LIFE after having completed the game, and I have since gone on a week-long WW3 information consumption streak, watching videos and reading Wikipedia articles about things to do with WW3. I have never ever experienced anything like this before, and I didn't know a video game could do that to you. The story is predictable but very believable and, in my opinion REALLY interesting once you have fully immersed yourself in the game. The gameplay is good, and while it may feel a bit sluggish and slow-paced at first, you will actually find that it does GREAT with your immersion and creating that constant vulnerable, ominous, and uneasy feeling. AI, let's be honest, is just bad, which sucks, as it does break your immersion sometimes, and graphics glitches do occur; however, I can forgive this game everything for the literally mind-boggling and out-of-this-world atmosphere that it has created around this game, and also the astonishing graphics, lighting (I played with ray-tracing on, and recommend you do, too (if you can), and amount of detail which only reinforce the already impossible feeling of immersion. Objectively speaking, I'd give it an 8.5, as it has got problems with glitches, AI, somewhat cliched general story, and also occasional, random low-res textures; however, if you manage to immerse yourself in the game even a little bit, I can guarantee you will have an unearthly experience. It's not perfect, but giving it anything less than a 10/10 would be a crime on my part.

Very nice graphics and the atmosphere. Stupid stealth gameplay nearly in the whole game that ruining the impression in general. I don't like stealth actions. Why do I should play stealth almost 70% of the game just to be "good person" and to have "good" ending.

В целом игра увлекательная, особенно проработка сюжета, графика. Но до звания шедевра ей мешает дотянуть убогая оптимизация и принужденность проходить половину игры в стелс-режиме ради хорошей концовки. Эта игра вполне отличное завершение удачной трилогии.

The game simply isn't fun. I'm not sure what happened here, but I feel like I'm playing 2033 with a fresh coat of paint and global illumination. I feel this game is the epitome of "beauty is skin deep".  This is a tedious mess that plays like a game from 2009. Your character feels drunk, and there are a myriad of elements in the environment to hinder your movement, adding to the pain. Simply traversing point A to point B is a chore. Your guns feel as though they fire rubber pellets, not bullets, and I find myself going through extreme amounts of ammo with the most basic of enemies. Oh yah, it's a "survival" game so all the resources, ammo, and health are scarce as f*** now, too. Environments are cramped and claustrophobic, offering little opportunity to make use of your weapons. Considering the amount of fighting taking place within 10 feet of your character, it is infuriating your only close attack is a weak sauce melee. Your health doesn't regenerate, and your character is made of paper, so you run through med kits with ease. You have to craft these, too. I can tell the developers wanted to make something "challenging", and "gritty", but instead the game is simply tedious, offering little compensation for your struggle. Not on Steam? The publisher knew they had a game that would never be profitable on its own, so the only way to break even was take Epic's money and cash in on whatever hype they had before anyone had a chance to play the game.
Game is okay and enjoying the story so far but so many issues with the EPIC launcher and crashing. I think this will be my last Epic Games purchased title.

as all my reviews, start from common things - just finished and never played previous game of series - yeah that my style =D so whats game about ? probably you know, but i will say it shortly: it final stage of artem's adventure in deadly world of mother Russia after nuclear war. sounds interesting isn't it ? developers tried to make it more interesting by adding a train - yeah. it's train adventure by whole territory of Russia with different biomes (in this game we can find tropic, desert, winter post apocalypses locations). not only different locations can surprise player, guns design can do it to. but not so good as we would like. i mean face animations, character animations leave much to be desired. the same goes for whole game work i mean on my pc it just deadly freeze after 2hours of work (but may be its only my problem idk). after all it seriously great game about life in post apocalypses world.
Good atmosphere, graphics...Poor gameply, mechanic..Overall, not much entertaining... Wouldnt recommend

Fantastic game for all lovers of the post-apocalypse. It offers an oppressive atmosphere and provides the usual metro thrill. The step towards smaller open worlds areas is an enourmous enrichment of the otherwise already very good Metro universe. The gunplay as well as the story know how to convince.

-Как либерал я соглашусь с тем, что игра - политическая пропаганда. Но не столько против левых идеалов, а против СССР и России в частности. В игре много двоемыслия, лицемерия и двойных стандартов.Также явно глуховский то ли даун ибо не верит что на западе бывают свои пропагандоны(ну эту профессию не в России изобрели, честно) и что они не ангелы коими себя разумеется рисуют (и не они одни), то ли ему приплачивают подобно наши отстёгивают всяким петухам на западе, чтобы те хейтили их режимы. -Противоборствующие стороны -  это просто гротескные персонажи детских сказок и графомания из фантазий школьника, напоминает высеры эмо-девочек в 2007ом году.Людоеды (из КПСС, разумеется, откуда еще?), пионеры и пираты (привет Ералаш), религиозные фанатики поклоняющиеся рыбе. Более смешно и инфантильно придумать разложение общества сложно.Глуховский по уровню серьезности не превышает фанфики и его офигительные истории по взрослости уступают даже детским комиксам.Можно было менее гротескно раскрыть проблемы общества и показать реальный ужас, которого мы в игре не увидели. Зато было дохуя пропаганды и выставление русских идиотами. Типичный необъективный бунтующий ксенопатриот - сам был таким же в 13 лет, помню. Но почему себя так же все еще ведет 40летний мужик - это вызывает вопросы. Не может быть взрослый человек настолько инфантильным, тут либо образ бунтаря, либо приплачивают. -Куколдия про неубийства. Такая пропаганда ни к чему не приведет и абсолютно неуместна, люди играют чтобы выпустить пар, а они такой хуйней лишь его аккумулируют, в результате чего человек может наверное и ебнуть кого-то ирл при возможности, вспомнив как ему 50 часов ебали мозг в игре куколдо-хуйней. (ни к чему не призываю, не оправдываю преступников, отъебитесь уже пидоры)Скорее всего сделана как попытка противопоставить "добрых" правых  и плохих жестоких воинственных левых. Не смотря на говно от Глуховского, 4A Games создали шикарный продукт в плане геймдизайна, души и атмосферы. Эмоции были противоречивы и за "декоммунизацию", за уничтожение памятника Ленина - человека что сделал рабов гражданами с правами... Ну, глуховский явно имперская ультра-правая празь, что поддерживает неравенство и эксплуатацию, таким как он не место в современном мире. Пишут тут в отзывах про "баги" - я никогда их в играх вообще не встречал, хотя у меня компьютеру уже почти 5 лет.Просто, наверное, уважаемые, нужно играть на адекватном железе, уверен у этих даунят пекам более 10 лет и все они разумеется "игровые".

В целом игра получилась хорошо. Однако есть свои минусы. Например оптимизация, она оказалась далеко от идеала. Постоянные микро-фризы, а также баги с анимацией связанные с ними. Освещение и отражения, а также дизайн локаций получился достойно и атмосферно. Диалоги да и в общем сюжет достаточно интересен и колоритен, в общем если вы любите атмосферу сталкера, то я советую эту игру к прохождению. Сам я остался доволен покупкой. (Несколько слов об Epic Games, Метро Исход я купил там. Особых проблемм с запуском игры не было, да...там отсутствуют некоторые особенности Steam (достижения и облачные сохранения), так что если вы не чураетесь Эпичного магазина, то можете немного сэкономить и купить там).
Great game, graphically stunning and a very good story. Will play again. Nuf said. Who cares where you get the game from .. really ...w@nkers

Its just an incredible game. Emotional, violent, charismatic characters,post-apocalyptic. The soundtrack is also amazing and suits very nicely the atmosphere of the game. Probably one of the best games ive played.
Reminder for people who reading user reviews  - you can skip everything with score below 4, this are just nonsense :)Game is great, some bugs maybe existed after release but now they are gone.

This review applies to the Russian version of the game, but anyway. I was a big fan of original books and first two games, but did hesitate to buy a new one till 08.2019. Although game was positioned as AAA and I personally didn't experience any technical issues, i was disappointed. Such a waste of money and time. Dead and dumb dialogs. interesting story turned into set of cliches. Graphics is good as an RTX demo, but it is absolutely useless in gameplay reanimation. Through all of the game I never lost a feeling that someone tried to save money on this title. Want to drive a car? Sure, but there will be only ONE! Radio station in the train with just one song on a loop, really?

The best part of the series: • Story 9/10• Graphics 9/10• Atmosphere 10/10• AI/Enemies 3/10 Would give 10/10, but because of some crashes, bugs and a dramatically stupid AI i have to reduce one point.

the game runs perfectly well on epic launcher .don't listen to trolls who are butthurt that the game is not on steam . the game has awesome story .i especially like the connection between anna and artyom as husband and wife .

The best game of Metro series. But there is feeling game designer lead me everywhere, you can’t miss up way or something kind of. Locations design becomes really better, but soundtrack should be more memorable and interesting the same like animations should be more advancedThanks 4A games

Одна из любимых серий игр. Может по этому всякие мелкие недоработки "осознанно не замечаю". Каких-то лютых багов-глюков не заметил. Есть несколько минусов: персонаж немой, атмосфера замкнутого мира потерялась, на локациях можно практически всех людей "уложить спать", зато масштаб происходящего несколько увеличился. Времена года показаны замечательно, даже несколько утрированно контрастно. В общем понравилось.
Отличная игра, одна из самых любимых, конечно есть некоторые огрехи в режисуре сюжета и немного багов но в целом очень хороша! с нетерпением жду следующую часть и обязательно ее куплю!

РЕВОЛЮЦИЯ СОЗНАНИЯ!Как бы кто не относился к видеоиграм, Metro exodus - величайшее творение на свете(можно сказать искусство), которое в полной мере поймёт только русский человек, так как именно живя в нынешней россии можно прочувствовать в полной мере всю боль героев игры, в игре ты испытываешь уникальное чувство интерактивности с миром игры засчёт различных геймплейных мелочей, которые сделали разработчики, также реализму игре добавляет то что можно пройти всю игру не убив ни одного человека. В игре в игре есть посыл, который можно понять, только действовав в игре так, как ты бы действовал в жизни, также игра наглядно показывает, что максимально плохое может произойти в нынешней России, как в государстве, а самое великое в игре это соундтрек, особенно "race against fate", эта композиция просто самая великая композиция в мире, благодаря которой в игре самая драматичная концовка из всех существующих в кино или играх, из минусов в игре много багов и неидеальный геймплей, ещё плохая анимация персонажей(ну тут разрабам просто денег не дали), но всё это меркнет на фоне остальных заслуг игры, 95-97/100 минимум. С этой игрой должен ознакомиться каждый человек на земле, каждый россиянин уж точно.English(bad):REVOLUTION OF CONSCIOUSNESS!No matter how anyone relates to videogames, Metro exodus is the greatest creation in the world that only a Russian person will fully understand, since it is living in today's Russia that you can fully experience all the pain of the heroes of the game, in the game you experience a unique sense of interactivity with the world of the game, due to the various gameplay details that the developers made, also adds realism to the game that you can go through the whole game without killing a single person.There is a message in the game that can be understood only by acting in the game the way you would in life, the game also clearly shows that the worst can happen in Russia because of the current the current government of Russia, and the greatest in the game is the soundtrack, especially "race against fate", this composition is simply the greatest composition in the world, thanks to which the game has the most dramatic ending of all existing in the world, shortcomings: the game has a lot of bugs and imperfect gameplay, still bad character animation (well, they simply didn’t give the developers money ), but all the advantages of the game outweigh the shortcomings, 95-97 / 100 minimum. This game should be played by every person on earth, every Russian certainly.

Сюжет интересный (но кое-где не обошлось без клише, и это печально), атмосфера хорошо проработана с вниманием к деталям, чего нельзя сказать о техническом исполнении. Игра может не запуститься или зависнуть при выходе в меню, кроме того имеют место баги и низкая кадровая частота на компьютере, удовлетворяющем системным требованиям. Однако, включив верт. синхронизацию, можно немного поднять некоторые настройки графики и играть с 45-60 fps на относительно слабом железе.

Grate gameFor a whole year, stubborn opponents of the Epic Games Store have been waiting for the post-apocalyptic thriller Metro Exodus to reach the virtual shelves of the Steam service.  The question of whether this will happen has never been - exclusivity in the EGS store has been declared temporary from the very beginning.  As expected, it will expire exactly one year after the premiere of the game.  Day to day.

I wish they would have just went one way or the other, open world or true to the metro cramped underground levels. I like the tactical combat, hated the fake morality system and ending it's tied to. I enjoyed the Caspian and Volga open worlds but they were fairly shallow as far as side missions and exploration. The last level was classic metro as were the first levels. But the filler levels of cannibals, forest etc could have been skipped, adds little to nothing. The obnoxious predictable "taking away all your weapons" to introduce garbage other ones, ugh The cringey dialogue and mandatory stuff that went along with it was really bad. Dumb characters and story overall. STILL has bugs today but the crashing seems to be patched up, if you still have that the answer is usually to turn off aa and turn most things down. I didn't really get into the replaying levels much after finishing kinda boring. SLOW loading times. Map system sucks. Boat mechanics are garbage, the mighty commando can't swim I guess and it's very frustrating to find where you can get off the boat in some levels.-DLC 1 is just an extended cutscene with some flamethrower combat, almost could just be a free dlc of cut from the main game flashback etc-DLC 2 is actually pretty good. This is where you can see the garbage that the "map" mechanic is, when you have to go online to find where to go then you have failed game design. Terrible boat mechanics are also highlighted in this one.

Still bugged ai walking through walls LOL! Very high input lag, even with no blur and ultra low input lag mode in nvidia control panel, while having 60+fps! Makes it hard to aim. It is worse than vsync triple buffering! When i move mouse, i can literally see the time: it takes for crosshair to move to a next position. I can't even follow target with mouse. Gameplay is terrible, because of that... Story is fine and voice acting is good. Ofc amazing graphics, even around objects there is grain or something and fire looks terrible! Level design could use improvement and stealth is ridiculous. You walk 1 m from him and he doesn't see you? It is honestly my fault, i chosen highest difficulty. But i had no idea it will be that awful. I played previous metro on highest difficulty fine... Ai is completely oblivious to you 90% of time and than they insta one shot kill you... I would have to start over by the time i realized that, so annoying. My sniper doesn't hit guy, when directly aiming at him, but he kills me on 100m with shotgun through 10 cm hole mkay... I don't know why we get so much high input lag games today, worse than in 2000. I guess it's terrible optimization... This game is terrible even on medium difficulty and level design is bad and bugged. You can't get up and than you die to flying mutant and have to replay whole part again... There is so high input lag, you can't hit anything even on medium it is problem many times... Whole experience is so bad, i am done uninstalling...

Would've been amazing, but some flaws hold it back. The Good - so much natural dialogue. Adds life to crew - dialogues with Anna are deep and gives you a deeper connection with her and your future above metro - a lot of extra optional dialogue and cutscenes that playout regardless if you're there or not making the environment feel alive, especially with life on the train. - your char is very vulnerable - you are very weak. It's realistic. You can get tired from sprinting a bit - you can choose to sit down and sometimes and listen to some lore. - variety of locations, with different weather and elements - you gain parts by taking mushrooms, but you lose light. Interesting trade-off. - the mutants are really well done. Some of the sea creatures are really nasty looking. - Ending wraps things up nicely. The Bad - hit detection is **** Enemy can be peeking behind cover with your reticule right over them. But it won't hit. - artyom has no voice, despite having monologues during loading screen - not having dialogue makes him feel like a shell - if you kill someone with a crossbow from far away, and other enemies see their comrade die, they automatically know where you are despite you being out of sight - you can be not in line of sight of opponent and they will still see you sometimes - enemies can be extremely difficult to spot sometimes especially if they have camo because there is no indicator or outline of their char model - tall grass and bushes do nothing in this game. Enemies will still see you if they've already spotted you. - the accent is very heavy, making it hard to understand if you aren't familiar with Russian accent english - some enemies sound like they are right next to you, but they're actually pretty far away. - checkpoints should be placed better. There should be a checkpoint right before are radioactive exploration area, and not a checkpoint while you're exploring are radioactive area. Because if you run out a filters and have not enough stuff to craft more then you are guaranteed to die. And if your checkpoint is one minute before you run out then you're screwed. - scripted boss fights are the worst. And the second mutant bear boss fight is just that. Worst part is that there's a believer with the lights behind it that makes you think you need to use it, but you can't. You have to damage the boss a lot then take damage purposely to trigger a cutscene, to end the fight.

По началу интересный сюжет , есть логика и в принципе играть интересно . Дальше начинается конечно бред , особенно когда тебе дают арбалет , я даже подумал , что в farcry 4 играю .  По поводу концовки не поддерживаю разработчиков . Серия была интересная , но помимо того , что саму игру " вывели из метро " , так и не дают рашерам хорошую концовку . То есть я должен тратить кучу времени на стелс миссии и никого не убивать  , печально . Одна концовка положительная концовка решила бы все проблемы , но они упорно плюют в лицо молодой аудитории , которые не могут часами лазить по одной локации .

A breath of fresh air, amid the suffocating dominance of tasteless, boring, tolerant and soulless games of our time.The finale of a great story about faith, hope, perseverance, loyalty and Love. Yes, who did not understand - this story is not about survival in a post-apocalyptic world, not about mutants, not about murder, but about something completely different. I can safely call the Metro trilogy the most anti-war story in existence. It seems to me that every politician, every person who believes that "war is cool", everyone who invents weapons of mass destruction and especially those who are responsible for their use, simply must pass this game. Russian people, the crew of the Aurora, are shown as realistic as possible, I speak as an ethnic Russian. The game was not made in the West, so you will not see any nonsense in the form of vodka, matryoshka, kalinka-malinka and other delusional Hollywood fantasies. The main characters of Aurora, they say, act and behave as they would most likely behave in real life. So if you have never seen a real Russian from Russia, but you really want to, then this game can help you a little to see them, at least with one eye. Of course, there is a small exploitation of the Soviet theme and some caricature nuances that are not found in real life, but which were made specifically for a wide audience from different countries, for better perception and immersion, but in general, these small stereotypes are not critical and if you are an adult, an adequate person, then perceive everything correctly. However, there is one huge " but " - English voice acting. It's just AWFUL. The English dubbing is so unprofessional that it's just disgusting. Absolutely the whole atmosphere is lost. English voice actors who simply read out the text with a caricatured, cranberry Russian accent, absolutely do not understand what is happening on the screen. They completely misinterpret the intonation of the voice and the emotions of the characters. Because of this, the true meaning of the dialogues is completely lost. I advise you to play only with Russian voice acting and subtitles in your native language. However, do what you want. After all, judging by the local comments, many people played this game just like a shooter, absolutely not using their brain and heart. But you should know that if you passed the game with a good ending and did not cry, then you are either still a child, or just a soulless, heartless freak. Of course, I would like to mention Anna separately. dear, dear Anya...a ray of hope, an Aurora talisman, and the other half of our soul. A woman, thanks to whom, I personally, rethought the very concept of "woman". Away from Aurora, wherever you are, you will only be warmed by the thought that she is waiting for you back. It does not clog the ether with useless chatter, it is not a burden, it does not whine or complain. She acts on an equal footing with everyone, makes her own contribution and is ready at any moment to risk her life for the sake of her comrades-in-arms and for the sake of her beloved man. A real woman, a real feminism. More than once I asked myself the question, would I be able to go to hell like Artyom and come back for the sake of my beloved woman? And you know, yes, I would go to the very depths of hell for such a woman and for true Love. In any case, you are waiting for an unthinkable, full of suspense and danger adventure. You will meet many different people, see how the War makes people monsters that are much more terrible than those that are generated by radiation. You will see people who, despite all the madness and horror, have not lost their human form, have not lost faith, hope, kindness and humanity. You yourself will have to go through a difficult test and understand who you really are, a man or another ugly spawn of War. You will find real comrades, friends who will become a real family for you, and the decrepit Aurora will become your real home. A home where you are truly expected, loved and respected.Even if it's just a game, just a story for a few nights, but this story changed me and from now on and forever, it will remain a part of my heart, a part of my soul. "I do not know how they will fight in World War 3, but in World War 4 they will fight with sticks and stones" © Albert Einstein
